nodes.thought: Identify values of x that make the denominator zero, by finding the solutions for x^2 + x - 6 = 0.
Find solutions for x^2 + x - 6 = 0 and identify as possible vertical asymptotes.

Let us determine the possible values of x where the function is undefined (x intercepts for the denominator). This will help us find vertical asymptotes. In this case, those points are solutions of the quadratic equation x^2 + x - 6 = 0.
